column1: We are running out of time. The House has already passed a COVID-19 relief bill – now the Senate must act. https://t.co/y3STa47GAl

COVID-19 cases are rising all over the country. The American people need assistance now.   @SenateMajLdr it is time to join the House in passing a comprehensive science-based relief bill to contain the spread of COVID-19 and help American families.

This is encouraging news and I applaud our scientific community for their work to develop a COVID-19 vaccine.   As we wait for a vaccine we must continue to stay safe and protect those around us.  https://t.co/7ukNte9o50

Michigan hospitals are seeing a surge in COVID-19 patients and we all have to do our part by wearing a mask social distancing and washing our hands. We have to work together and listen to the experts. https://t.co/nmlkJL7ETL

The President-elect’s COVID-19 Advisory Board shows that the Biden administration will employ the scientific evidence-based approach to tackling this virus that we have needed for some time. https://t.co/C0AKgrv22m

The Trump Administration is STILL in court trying to dismantle the Affordable Care Act as COVID-19 cases reach record highs.   More than 1 in 3 Americans live with a pre-existing condition. They deserve a government that will protect their access to healthcare not undermine it. https://t.co/NM2Vn0bzKu

COVID-19 cases are on the rise in Michigan and across the country. Please stay safe and remember to follow public health guidelines like washing your hands wearing a mask and physical distancing. https://t.co/ct2xwIu6DZ

COVID-19 cases are rising across the Midwest. Michiganders should continue following CDC guidelines. Masks handwashing and social distancing can save thousands of American lives. https://t.co/a1g4Fn5Khk
Great to see @umichmedicine play such an important role in the race for a COVID-19 vaccine.  https://t.co/8hmuQs4qFU
Wear a mask in public.  Social distance as much as possible.  Get a flu shot.  Listen to the experts.   We can get through this.
From @MFGDay 2019. These words still ring true today even more so after watching our manufacturers step up during the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/v5WKIykMRD

for families small businesses and local governments. We will not be able to fully rebuild our economy until we defeat COVID-19 through investments in testing contact tracing and vaccine development all of which are included in this bill. (2/3)

The CDC must collect and publish data tracking the spread of COVID-19 in our schools.   Students parents teachers staff and administrators need this information to keep themselves safe and develop best practices for a return to in-person learning. https://t.co/NQ4GqQieEV

There is no place for discrimination against the AAPI community.   Not now not ever.   Today I voted for #HRes908 condemning all forms of anti-Asian sentiment as related to COVID-19. https://t.co/d8nuG65Pai

We have lost over 190000 Americans to COVID-19. The economy is struggling. Millions of people are out of work. It’s time for Senator McConnell to join us and take action to pass aid to states cities towns and schools! #FundTheFrontlines

COVID-19 has disrupted university research across the country slowing innovation and the development of new technologies.    As Chair of the @HouseScience Research & Technology Subcommittee I held a hearing yesterday to examine this important issue.⤵️ https://t.co/7S9AxqiuZ0

Earlier this year I co-founded the Congressional Women in STEM Caucus to advocate for a diverse talent pipeline in STEM fields.   Thank you to @scicoalition @DrMichelleBIO and others for yesterday’s informative briefing on the role of the STEM workforce in our COVID response. https://t.co/dHoVhbkCGI

Over the last few weeks I visited 26 communities across #MI11 with a mix of virtual and socially-distant events.   It’s an honor to spend time in our communities and connect with constituents. Grateful for all our incredible district affords! #26TownsTour https://t.co/IqCYm1agnR

University research is critical to U.S. innovation and economic growth but COVID has slowed efforts to develop new technologies and make scientific discoveries.   At 11:30am I’m chairing a @HouseScience hearing to examine the impact of COVID on research. https://t.co/7S9AxqiuZ0

Tomorrow morning I’m convening a @HouseScience hearing to discuss the impact of COVID-19 on university research.   We will be joined by a panel of expert witnesses including our very own @StoneDavidA from @OaklandResearch!    More info: https://t.co/PxKh5ecSjv

As we head into Labor Day weekend please remember that COVID-19 is still spreading in our state. Public health experts are warning that large gatherings this weekend could cause further spread of the virus. Please be smart and safe this weekend!
Join us TODAY at 2pm at the link below for our Facebook Live roundtable discussion about the COVID-19 pandemic the Affordable Care Act and issues facing older Americans! https://t.co/5vcC6u2I3C
Happening tomorrow at 2pm!! Join us on Facebook Live for a discussion on the COVID-19 pandemic the Affordable Care Act and the issues facing older Americans. https://t.co/X8xc67Jtt0

We’re planning a town hall with a panel of experts for August 25th focused on manufacturing in the time of COVID-19. Our #MI11 manufacturers stepped up to help our nation produce PPE and we're so grateful for their efforts.   Submit your questions here: https://t.co/x2daEEp4VA

COVID-19 is as dangerous as it is unpredictable. Scientists and doctors are learning every day what symptoms can indicate an infection the different ways it targets the body and how to better stop the spread.  https://t.co/QKHG6YchMv

Work and personal life have come crashing together as many Americans began working from home this year. After hearing so many stories like these we must find better ways to protect women from employer discrimination in the time of COVID-19.   https://t.co/3l9OskDPLc

Thanks to all who participated in our Town Hall on education in the time of COVID-19. This school year will be challenging but after hearing from our panel of experts & voices from our community I think our students can look forward to a successful year. https://t.co/VUtofEUwm9 https://t.co/NJPSAVfu77
Happening soon – tonight’s town hall focused on education in the time of COVID-19! I am looking forward to our conversation please join us by watching at the link below: https://t.co/gTMCIyvnJN

Going back to school will be very different this fall whether your district opts for online classroom or hybrid education.  We will talk about all things education in the time of COVID-19 during our town hall at 6:30pm tonight– join us on Facebook Live! https://t.co/TCc39vz6k4

#MI11: Have a question about education during the COVID-19 pandemic?  We have a panel of experts joining us for a Facebook Live Town Hall on education at 6:30pm tomorrow – submit your question at the link below: https://t.co/UsAVC8xsf6

📣 NEWS 📣  I am so excited to announce my #26TownsTour! Over the next few weeks I am going to visit 26 towns across Michigan’s 11th District with a mix of virtual and socially distant events.  So far this week: Wixom Auburn Hills and Plymouth Township. ⤵️ https://t.co/CdijKA2dQ9

Last week the House passed an appropriations bill that included my provisions to support critical manufacturing & research priorities: ✅ American-made aerospace composites  ✅ Hypersonics R&D ✅ @NSF COVID-19 research ✅ @NSF STEM education programs https://t.co/0a7ZrqrBEn

As COVID-19 cases in the U.S. reach 4.5 million the Trump Administration is still trying to repeal the Affordable Care Act. Last night I voted to prevent the Department of Justice from spending taxpayer dollars on their lawsuit to strike down the ACA. https://t.co/DIT6Sx9Ij1

In 2019 MI had the 7th highest number of trafficking cases in the country. On this World Day Against Trafficking in Persons we must commit to doing what we can to ensure the COVID-19 crisis does not worsen the international crisis of human trafficking. https://t.co/BTE83MTfv3

Thirteen Felician sisters at a convent in Livonia have died from COVID-19. There are no words to express the sorrow we all feel about the loss of these beautiful souls who did so much to serve their community.   https://t.co/n7ag3eS4m6

American manufacturers stepped up to create PPE & medical equipment during this pandemic but COVID-19 exposed serious vulnerabilities in critical supply chains.  Today I introduced a bipartisan bill to make our manufacturing supply chains more resilient: https://t.co/JNbH9x5A9C

We must stand strong against hate. Racist slurs & jokes are never acceptable.  Associating COVID-19 with a country region or ethnicity is inaccurate unhelpful & makes it harder for the public health officials to do their jobs and contain the disease.  https://t.co/SQvzPxaZRU

What happened in Michigan was personal. The Trump Admin did nothing. But they continue to deploy secret police and use force against peaceful protestors across the country.   From disregarding COVID-19 to failing to make our schools safer the American people are sick of it. https://t.co/Zk1tKf2iVP

When the COVID-19 pandemic hit Michigan many small businesses had difficulties cutting through the red tape to get the federal relief they needed. That’s when my office was able to step in and help.  https://t.co/C4wLf44HXA

Nearly 75000 Michiganders have tested positive for COVID-19.   We are doing better than many other states right now but if we are going to contain this virus we have to be smart and be safe by social distancing and wearing masks.  https://t.co/ryHZUWCu7F

The amount of pain and suffering caused by COVID-19 is hard to fathom. My heart goes out to the Ismael family of Michigan. I will never stop fighting for health care a science first response and caring for those most impacted by this pandemic. https://t.co/DXEsQnmsMy

I am back in DC this week. We are getting right to work spending the next two weeks working on a bipartisan compromise to help the American people as we continue to battle the COVID-19 pandemic.   We will not let you fail. #MI11 https://t.co/5lUj9Cdulk

I’m introducing a bipartisan bill to help low-income families afford their utility bills during the COVID-19 pandemic because Michigan families should not have to choose between paying their energy bills and putting food on the table.   Learn more:  https://t.co/rWMcdejnCV

Michigan manufacturers have stepped up throughout this crisis creating desperately-needed PPE and medical equipment for frontline workers. Now they may play a role in producing a life-saving COVID-19 vaccine.  https://t.co/lOmQJ4uqvk

Tomorrow @HouseScience is hosting an important hearing: “Sweltering in Place: COVID-19 Extreme Heat and Environmental Justice.” Looking forward to this timely discussion about public health our environment and our future.   Watch live at 2pm tomorrow: https://t.co/3vAUckWDQq

MI manufacturers are doing everything they can to get back to work safely during the pandemic. This new federal grant funding for the MI Manufacturing Technology Center will help them prepare for & respond to COVID-19 helping our economy get back on track https://t.co/Z0nVpkac10

ICYMI: The Michigan Manufacturing Technology Center will receive a $2.1 million federal grant to help Michigan manufacturers respond to COVID-19.   This is great news for our incredible manufacturing economy as our state faces unprecedented challenges. https://t.co/Z0nVpkac10

In March I pushed for emergency funding for @NIST_MEP because I knew their guidance could help save manufacturing jobs.   Today I am thrilled to announce that the Michigan Manufacturing Technology Center will receive $2.1 million to help our manufacturers respond to COVID-19.
Now is a great time to go out and explore nature while staying socially distant.   Glad to see some new biking trails opening up in Northville! 🚲🚲 https://t.co/LpNaKD74P8

Great news for our Oakland County vets!! Oakland County has established $1 million in emergency financial assistance for Oakland County veterans service members and eligible family members affected by the COVID-19 pandemic. Check it out: https://t.co/1OUoQCgxD3

Today we had a great hearing on @EdLaborCmte on racial inequities and the COVID-19 crisis.  The Flint water crisis happened years before the pandemic but is still ongoing. The parallels with communities of color are undeniable.

At 12pm @EdLaborCmte is holding a hearing to examine how COVID-19 widened racial inequities in education health & the workforce. This is an important discussion and I look forward to hearing from our expert witnesses.  Watch live at 12pm: https://t.co/Wtxtb4TpUY

TONIGHT: @ 6:15pm Delighted to announce Township Supervisor Bob Nix is joining for our tele-town hall to discuss COVID-19 & economic recovery. Bob is an experienced municipal leader who knows the importance of working across the aisle to deliver for our region. https://t.co/2AGeirN95Z

Tomorrow at 6:15pm I am hosting a tele-town hall focused on our economic recovery from the COVID-19 pandemic. The health and economic consequences of this pandemic have been felt by so many and I look forward to taking your questions. Please join us at https://t.co/cgl9AHM8Bq. https://t.co/mdLtav5t5k

Due to unprecedented budget shortfalls Michigan schools are facing devastating funding cuts.   Our students deserve better.   At 12pm I'm joining my @EdLaborCmte colleagues for a hearing to assess the impact of COVID-19 on our public schools.  https://t.co/Jjf6QJVZAV
TOWN HALL: Join us on Tuesday evening for a telephone town hall on economic recovery and the COVID-19 pandemic.  Sign up to receive a call at https://t.co/cgl9AHM8Bq. #MI11 https://t.co/N6o2V1SLVo

Join us next Tuesday evening for a telephone town hall focused on our economic recovery from the COVID-19 crisis. I look forward to hearing from you and answering your questions.   Sign up to receive a call at 6:15pm on Tuesday: https://t.co/cgl9AHM8Bq https://t.co/YqxIipbYMt

As our heroic fire fighters support COVID-19 response efforts staffing shortages and a lack of PPE are creating serious challenges. Today @HouseScience is examining federal grant programs to get fire departments the resources they need to keep us safe.   https://t.co/LhKCHHnzsc

A delight to be with @ASMEdotorg for today’s virtual town hall on economic recovery from COVID-19. An incredible organization that sets standards and helps train the workforce of the future. https://t.co/9kYBEQWS6M

Our public education system has never dealt w/ a crisis like COVID-19 but MI schools are ready for the challenge. I had a great meeting w/ #MI11 K-12 Superintendents & School Board Presidents today to discuss their needs during the pandemic & how Congress can support their work. https://t.co/pW05O9esWb

Scientists of all backgrounds are joining the breakneck race to understand track model and mitigate the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic. @NSF is leading the way mobilizing the scientific community in unprecedented ways to beat back our common enemy. https://t.co/EnvM4na4VL

I took a moment of silence at noon today to remember the over 100000 lives that have been lost in this country due to COVID-19. If you are able I ask that you join me and help keep the memories of those who have passed alive. #DayOfMourning https://t.co/YmcTz6K24H

CVS has opened 4 new testing sites for COVID-19 in #MI11.  They are in Clawson (1402 W. 14 Mile) Milford (720 General Motors Road) Walled Lake (100 West Maple Road) & Northville (44300 5 Mile Road). Learn more & register for a testing appointment here: https://t.co/cSlp6tENpZ

We’re not going to achieve herd immunity from COVID-19 any time soon. Our vaccine developers are working as hard as they can.  So for now: 😷 Wear a face mask 🙅‍♀️ Stay 6 ft away 👏 Wash your hands https://t.co/EpS31yg5Lg

COVID-19 has caused the worst worker safety crisis in decades and we must do more to ensure vulnerable workers have adequate protections.   Watch today’s @EdLaborCmte hearing on worker safety LIVE at 10:15am ⤵️ https://t.co/VzFTxumUAN
Thank you @NYTimes for recognizing Alice Chavdarian of Plymouth Township as part of last Sunday’s powerful tribute for COVID-19 victims across the country. https://t.co/Kr6SROYRQo

Hello! 👋 I'm in DC for an @EdLaborCmte hearing to examine the federal government’s actions to protect workers from COVID-19. This will be an important discussion & I encourage you to tune in at 10:15am tomorrow. What's on your mind regarding this topic? https://t.co/VzFTxumUAN
Child care is an essential service to so many Michigan families and COVID-19 may cause irreparable damage to the child care sector.

This #OlderAmericansMonth we celebrate the contributions seniors have made in our families and communities. As we continue to confront the #COVID19 pandemic we must ensure they have the support they need. https://t.co/x5RfTXhFtD

America’s Mayors are leading the fight against Covid-19 in communities across this country. Thank you to my Mayor @MayorBarnett who leads the U.S. Conference of Mayors for his time and guidance with our freshman class yesterday. https://t.co/ozqr5uiuLj

First responders health care workers food industry employees and other essential workers should not have to choose between financial security and safety. Basic protections for sick days help retain skilled workers and reduce the threat of a COVID-19 outbreak in the workplace.

As a former official at @US_EDA I'm familiar with their disaster recovery programs that will help Midland rebuild. Some programs are already being utilized because of COVID-19 but these efforts will be important for communities devastated by the flooding https://t.co/qaEKGYDB4t
TESTING: All adults in Oakland County now have access to free COVID-19 testing.   Call 1-800-848-5533 to set up an appointment.  https://t.co/y3di2X3ixW

Thank you so much to everyone who participated in our town hall focused on parents and families in the time of coronavirus. If you missed our event the video is available here: https://t.co/khFNZdDKcR

Yesterday's teleconference was the first installment in a series of briefings we will continue to hold on the ongoing research and technology needs in the age of coronavirus and preexisting needs that still deserve our attention.

As manufacturing training programs at the K-12 level have been put on hold due to COVID-19 we must find a way to engage the next generation in ongoing innovation efforts. This work is more important than ever before.
I was proud to fight for funding for the Institutes in the CARES Act and it was great to hear from @NIIMBL on their early use of this funding to aid in the development of COVID-19 testing/vaccines.
Yesterday I hosted a bipartisan teleconference on @MFGUSA COVID-19 response and recovery as Chairwoman of the @HouseScience Research and Technology Subcommittee.  https://t.co/DvvDKEkm1B

Livonia has one of the highest COVID-19 mortality rates in the nation yet they have not received the federal support they need to fight this pandemic. Federal funding to municipalities must be distributed to the communities with the most urgent need.  https://t.co/ZI1UGJpkdj

An important reminder. We are learning more about COVID-19 every day and we need to stay alert and informed about the latest guidance from experts and public health officials.  https://t.co/1339RDWpwb

From my interview with Bloomberg TV yesterday.  Detroit hustles harder. Our auto industry has dealt with a crisis before. We've transformed over and over again and we will overcome through the coronavirus crisis too. https://t.co/DbwQtn8ZwT

COVID-19 has spread rapidly through our criminal justice system in Michigan. We have a responsibility to keep everyone in our community safe and stop the spread of this deadly disease wherever it exists.  https://t.co/fyur2VoJVl

I will keep fighting to get much-needed federal funding to Livonia because it is absolutely unacceptable for a city with the second-most coronavirus deaths in Michigan to rank toward the bottom in CARES Act funds received.

As we fight the COVID-19 pandemic we need to ensure that federal funds are going to the communities that need them most.   Last month I led a bipartisan letter calling for direct fiscal relief for small and mid-sized cities like Livonia.  https://t.co/zt4XdIKPYZ
Have you recovered from COVID-19? Your fellow Americans need your help. Learn about donating your blood plasma here: https://t.co/vYWWbNBtZF

We’ve already begun to make federal COVID-19 response resources available to Native Americans. @RepDebHaaland co-chair of the House Native American Caucus has a great guide on her website outlining the Tribal resources in the recently passed CARES Act. https://t.co/O2vz6nnfvo

The coronavirus pandemic has hit Native American communities hard. No other group of people has suffered more from infectious diseases in the US than Native Americans and we must work hard to ameliorate the health and economic disaster they are facing. https://t.co/oyDFVvzrKc
A very happy anniversary to Sarah and William Niffin! I’m glad you were both able to be surrounded by (socially distantl) love on your special day. https://t.co/NwFoSKgVjq

The next COVID-19 relief package must address the multi-employer pension crisis.   Now more than ever we need to secure the retirements of more than a million hard-working Americans.   Here’s what I told my @EdLaborCmte colleagues last week: https://t.co/bJ6Xl8Wdf8

Nursing homes & long-term care facilities in MI have been hit hard by COVID-19.  These facilities are struggling to keep residents & staff safe we need to work together to do everything we can to support our nursing homes using funding from the CARES Act. https://t.co/FXrD65JCvv
On Friday I joined my @EdLaborCmte colleagues for a virtual forum to discuss our response to COVID-19. Watch my remarks here: https://t.co/0XMhENK4dC

COVID-19 has devastated nursing homes & long-term care facilities in MI. It’s not acceptable. We need the federal government working to ensure that residents & staff at these facilities are equipped with the resources they need to stay safe. https://t.co/trO6e34uD7

For the second “stop” on my Listening Engagement and Action Tour I heard from our small business owners in downtown Milford Northville and Farmington on the impacts of COVID-19 and how we can form partnerships to help them successfully reopen. https://t.co/ZVedPGjHFK

Armand and Ruthie Vigna will be dearly missed. COVID-19 may have taken them from us but it cant take away our memory or love for them.  These are the people we are trying to protect when we stay home to keep ourselves and others safe. https://t.co/daZA5Yzggl

Yesterday I convened a bipartisan briefing with a couple of our amazing experts at @NIST. The call was focused on the impacts of COVID-19 on U.S. manufacturing and how research and innovation can help us address this pandemic.

1.3 million retirees are in danger of losing their hard-earned retirement benefits due to the multi-employer pension crisis and COVID-19 is straining these struggling pension plans even further.   It's time to fix the multi-employer pension crisis.  https://t.co/DEpIGMuUQq
#MI11: If you are looking for help for your family or business during this crisis the COVID-19 section of my website is a great place to start.  https://t.co/rjticDK6mx
Yesterday I joined @AARPMichigan for a telephone town hall focused on COVID-19.   Here is a brief summary of the topics we discussed on the call: https://t.co/9CmZOk64oP

So many Michigan families depend on child care centers but many of these critical businesses are in danger of shutting down permanently due to COVID-19.   We must not ignore this problem. Child care centers need federal support to survive this lockdown.  https://t.co/GVKhjFjQzx
I refuse to abandon our towns and cities when they need our help. My mantra: In the face of COVID-19 we will not let you fail.

Today is International Workers’ Memorial Day.   Today we mourn the health care providers grocers and other essential workers who have fallen victim to COVID-19.   We owe it to them to do everything we can to protect essential workforces during this crisis.

TOMORROW: I am joining @AARPMichigan for a telephone town hall to discuss the federal response to COVID-19 and how Congress can support older Americans during this pandemic.   Join us:  📢COVID-19 town hall with @AARPMichigan  🗓️Tomorrow April 28th ⏰11:10 AM  ☎️833-380-0616
There is still a lot we are learning about COVID-19 and it is important to remember it is a novel virus. https://t.co/MvWP0WSjsp

This is an essential first step in making our COVID-19 testing more widely available which will help us determine when we can safely open our state again. Thank you to all working on the front lines here to make this available! https://t.co/w13DX3Eifo

Spoke to Bloomberg News yesterday about Michigan’s fight against the coronavirus pandemic and how our health outcomes are tied to our economic interests.   In short everyone matters in my book and I won’t let you fail.  Watch here: https://t.co/n3EhXdmrho
How has COVID-19 changed your life?  Tell me your story.  https://t.co/XLi5M6WzJc

Michigan is one of the hardest-hit states in the country with more than 30000 COVID-19 cases and over 1 million new unemployment claims.   So why aren’t Michigan small businesses receiving their fair share of federal support? We are trying to find out. https://t.co/8apbmEwBJf
Michigan now has a website to find a COVID-19 testing site near you.     Just follow the link below and plug in your address to find a test and learn more about availability. https://t.co/ecH24Ak6i8

Our cities counties and states need more support to fight this pandemic as their revenues dry up.   I am fighting for additional stabilization funding for state and local governments in the next COVID-19 relief package.  https://t.co/LnQXRO1iXo
Proud of everyone involved who got this facility working so quickly to help people in need of continued care for COVID in Detroit. Together we can beat this! https://t.co/i390wo3d31

This year #BlackMaternalHealthWeek comes in the midst of a pandemic. The racial disparities in COVID-19 outcomes reflect ongoing disparities in maternal mortality rates in the US. As a member of the @BMHCaucus I am working hard to address this crisis. #BMHW20 https://t.co/ADIgFak6Iv

Automakers and suppliers are experiencing severe supply chain disruption due to COVID-19 and they need an appropriate adjustment period to ensure the new automotive rule of origin regulations in USMCA are implemented successfully.  https://t.co/lBAXCed50y

On Monday evening at 6:30pm I am hosting another telephone town hall to answer your questions about the COVID-19 pandemic.   Sign up to receive a call at https://t.co/cgl9AHuxcQ. https://t.co/T8LrZONQQw

My office has been checking in with nursing homes & senior living centers in #MI11 to learn about what they are experiencing and how we can help. It is evident they lack the support and resources they need to protect their staff and patients from COVID-19. https://t.co/z4kRnbNPJg

On Monday April 13th at 6:30pm I’ll be hosting my third telephone town hall on COVID-19. I know many of you have questions and I’m eager to answer as many as I can during this event. Join us at https://t.co/cgl9AHM8Bq! https://t.co/GSpPX0SxnE

“Our cities are on the front lines of the fight against COVID-19 and we have an obligation to provide sufficient funding to keep their doors open so they can continue fighting this invisible war.” https://t.co/6K4vsnb5ew

The COVID-19 pandemic is changing our world fast. I've dedicated time to talk directly to constituents & hear about what they are experiencing & what I can do to help. If you're interested in receiving a call from me or my staff please fill out our form. https://t.co/mXlc1mrUqZ

As a part of my extensive COVID-19 resource guide I have a whole page dedicated to resources for non-profits community & faith-based organizations. See that list and more here: https://t.co/YQrG8FzB7R

I will never stop fighting for Michigan families.   We are living through an unprecedented crisis but we are going to get through this together.   If you need help please visit the COVID-19 Resource Guide on my website or call (734) 853-3040.  https://t.co/CoRfq4GpvD

I’ve been updating our COVID-19 resource page on a daily basis with the latest information about economic impact payments small business loans/grants frequently asked questions and more. See more at https://t.co/rjticDK6mx

I’m sure many of you have questions about the Economic Impact Payments that are being distributed as part of the federal response to COVID-19. Here is an FAQ my office put together to answer the most common questions we’ve received from constituents: https://t.co/zbET7QmKTz

For information on unemployment benefits housing assistance utility assistance food resources mental health resources and more visit the COVID-19 resource guide on my website: https://t.co/3xjVmUE3Hd.   And as always call my office if you have any questions: (734) 853-3040

I want to get the chance to talk to you to hear in your own words how the COVID-19 pandemic has affected you and how I can help.   If you're interested in receiving a call from me or my staff please fill out our form below. https://t.co/mXlc1mrUqZ

The COVID-19 resource guide on my website now includes more loan and grant info for businesses mental health resources updates from state & local gov and FAQ’s about direct cash payments. Check it out here: https://t.co/rjticDK6mx

ICYMI: Earlier this week I joined @DetroitChamber for a telephone town hall to discuss the federal response to the COVID-19 crisis and the resources available for businesses. Listen here: https://t.co/QpRluiO7p8

300000 Michiganders filed for unemployment last week.   If you live in #MI11 and need assistance please visit our COVID-19 resource guide at https://t.co/2LKyXJMjmp or call my office at 734-853-3040.   We will get through this.  https://t.co/rPETmpMSVn

If you have a story about how COVID-19 has impacted you and your family I want to hear it.    Please fill out this webform to share your story. I read these submissions every night and use your stories to inform our federal response to this crisis.  https://t.co/XLi5M7eb7M

This is good news. Michigan is getting hit hard by COVID-19 right now and the National Guard can provide critical humanitarian support during this crisis from distributing food and medical supplies to helping operate COVID-19 testing facilities.  https://t.co/nYDPwcBVOG
In a few minutes I’m joining @DetroitChamber for a telephone town hall on COVID-19.   Sign up below ⤵️ https://t.co/NV4IqC0sDv

Today is #EqualPayDay & we can't forget the fact that women EACH lose an average of $10k+ to the wage gap each year- the equivalent of several months of rent. Amidst the #COVID19 pandemic too many families are scrambling to be able to pay rent tomorrow. https://t.co/S7joqinB7p

At 5pm TONIGHT I’m hosting a telephone town hall with @LtGovGilchrist @donofriojeff and @msashas to discuss the latest updates in the fight against COVID-19.   Please tune in at https://t.co/cgl9AHM8Bq. #MI11
I talked to @johnkingcnn this morning to discuss the federal response to the COVID-19 pandemic and what’s happening on the ground in MI-11. Watch ⤵️ https://t.co/np3NMY0kZQ
